website_summaries.verdict: Convenient, efficient, high-quality product with a budget price. Very well designed, delivers quality results with little effort.
pros: Extra-large press box can press multiple gloves
cons: Dishwasher cleaning is sometimes not enough to clean in between the holes

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Garlic Press
customer_reviews.text: I like this press. Is the second one I have purchased. Lost the first due to a hurricane. It is very sturdy and does the job. Easy to clean out. The husk remover that comes with it works very well also. Can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Blasterman

customer_reviews.title: Great for Garlic, awesome for Key Limes
customer_reviews.text: Great garlic press that takes little effort to get maximum results. Does a great job on garlic, but it is awesome at juicing Key Limes. When making Key Lime pies it literally takes 1/3 the number of limes to get the juice needed when compared to a conventional manual juicer. Easy cleanup just adds to the bargain that is the
customer_reviews.author: Tim Treadupon

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product! I absolutely love this Garlic Press and it feels very handy and nice. It is made from quality pieces with strong and solid grip. The other two accessories that come with it are pretty much useless as you can see in the video or perhaps I don’t know how to work with them. Overall I am pretty satisfied with my purchase. Great for garlic lovers!
customer_reviews.author: AlexiosFini

customer_reviews.title: The best garlic press
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this garlic press and quite honestly, didn't feel like I needed one. In the past I have used garlic presses and found cleaning them to be a huge pain to clean. The press plate on this garlic press is hinged allowing the plate to be cleaned easily. It's sturdy! I find myself using it quite often. To clean, I use my finger to remove the remnants of the smashed garlic from the press, rinsing in the sink, and tossing it in the dishwasher. Even the included silicone garlic peeler is great. A must for the kitchen, and easier to clean than other garlic presses I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best Functional Chef’s Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing!! The design and smooth functionality makes mincing not a chore. Flip out part is ideal and makes cleaning it so easy. This is a must have for all chefs in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to clean, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Dont like this product at all. It's an absolute monster to try to clean. There are small lines of space in the wall of the square, and thin strands of garlic will ooze out and get stuck in those lines. The only way I've been able to ensure that everything comes out of the press enough to clean is to soak it in hot water overnight, let the remaining pieces of garlic float out on their own, and THEN finally be able to clean it. It's a giant hassle and not worth buying at all.
customer_reviews.author: concerned

customer_reviews.title: Broke in half with first use.
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly pretty impressed with the product upon initial unwrapping. It looked like it was good quality, the little garlic roller/peeler thing was pretty cool and worked great. However, with literally the second clove of garlic I ever put in it, the pin around which the two handles swing breaks in half and pops off into my food and the two handles came apart. Doesn't look like something that can be fixed. Pretty bummed I bought this product. I'd recommend something simpilar and stronger for a garlic press. The fancier they get, the less long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Best garlic press.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this garlic press. I bought one that was from a different company and it broke immediately upon use. This garlic press is made from stainless steel and is very sturdy. It's probably the best garlic press I've ever used. Im highly satisfied with this purchase, and truthfully, after using the item. I'm never going to be buying garlic press that is not stainless steel. This garlic press will likely last a really long time because of how well it's built and the quality of material used
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Key word STAINLESS STEEL!!!
customer_reviews.text: It feels professional, looks professional and it’s real stainless steel. It’s not junk aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tall

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I broke our recent by "using excessive force" as my wife puts it, so I convinced her to get this one so that would not be a problem. That has certainly been the case. We have been very satisfied with its usefulness and sturdiness. A must buy for my stronger handed chefs!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I did really like this set when I first got it. However, using it a couple of times got tedious. There’s three pieces to the garlic press. The middle piece causes smooshed garlic to come up and get everywhere. It does the job, overall. I’m just not a fan. I prefer the two-piece presses. I am grateful to have found out about the peeler. Didn’t know that was a thing. The downside to that is sometimes I press too hard and it will smoosh the garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Myko B

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra couple bucks on the PC brand
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. I have the PC brand at my Fiancee's house. That one works great. This one: NOT easy to squeeze, (I often can't even do it with two hands). Too much of the 'garlic meat' oozes out the sides and mixes with the bulb shell/wrapper, whatever it's called, wasting a lot. (Sorry I am not a chef and don't know all the lingo, I just know I love fresh garlic, LOL). And it is a pain in the rear to clean. It gets the job done, but very poorly. Spend the extra few bucks on the big named brand one. (Just edited after using the thing again and decided 3 stars was too generous).
customer_reviews.author: Janis K

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not well constructed. The sides have slits that garlic can get stuck in.
customer_reviews.author: Aspara gus

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy, no peeling necessary! Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I started out with a coated aluminum press that could handle the garlic with the skin still on. Over time the coating came off and it looked terrible. I also wanted to avoid aluminum, so I went in search of stainless steel that could handle the kind of force one need to process a clove still on its paper skin. This fits the bill perfectly! Also, the leftover bits of skin flip right out no problem! My old garlic crusher never cleaned this easily. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Teague

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The peeler does not function at all. It will break your cloves or do nothing. Certainly not peel them. The press itself will also push peels through. Ringing garlic in the process. So if you want this to function you will first have to peel the garlic by hand then press it. Defeating the entire purpose of a garlic press in reducing work. Thank you for my shiny $18 piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Lefko

customer_reviews.title: Finally found
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a garlic press that WORKS for years. Once had a great one that actually pressed the cloves but it was made of the an alloy that turned black with time and shared the color with the garlic. Not nice! Over the years (30-40), I have purchased several presses which could not truly crush the garlic. They were a complete waste in all ways. Finally, this beautiful, shiny stainless steel garlic press works, nicely pressing the cloves for cooking. It does take a strong hand but is easy to clean in the dishwasher. The included brush if needed helps but the silicone tube for freeing the cloves of the skin before pressing is marvelous.
customer_reviews.author: PattyM

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: There are some great features. But don't kid yourself. You will touch garlic. And you will need significant hand strength to use it. It has all the usual problems of any garlic press. Best feature is the thing you roll the cloves around in bc it helps get the peels off more easily. I want to return it but don't know how bc of course in order to know if I liked it, I had to try it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Rubber sleeve is awesome too!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Exactly what I’ve been needing. I always add extra garlic by mincing/crushing/hand grating which takes way longer than this. The rubber sleeve makes peeling very easy. Press is comfortable to use. I can rinse it clean very easily too. Should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: KamB

customer_reviews.title: it's not great, but very good
customer_reviews.text: It could be easier to clean. It could take less pressure to use. It's generally quite functional, and the rubber rolling sleeve for peeling off garlic skins does work amazingly well. "Professional Grade" is really pushing it. This is not that. It will be a perfectly good tool for moderate use. It is not something you want if you use garlic every day.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: Too much time to use and clean everytime
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and put it away. You waste more time using and cleaning this thing every time you squeeze garlic than cutting and smashing it yourself with a knife
customer_reviews.author: Ram DA

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend. The press is not removable and it's a pain to clean. It's more difficult to press than my old kitchen aid garlic press. The kitchen aid press was easy to push down while this one is surprisingly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Swejl

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect.  good, not good enough tho
customer_reviews.text: nice press, it's good quality. my only issue is that the "bucket" area of the press is not a closed structure... the outside wall in the area you put garlic in is not welded to the other walls, it's just an upward bent piece of metal... so there's a small gap in each corner there... and the tougher garlic skin ALWAYS wedges itself in those gaps, which makes cleaning harder. if the bucket area was a single pressed area, or the corners were welded, this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had other garlic presses in the past that were either too flimsy or too small. Both of which fell apart easily and snapped when using too much pressure. This garlic press however, is amazing. It’s sturdy and strong. It’s great quality and can crush multiple cloves with no problems. I love that there is a little brush included for cleaning and even a little tool that helps take the garlic peels off beforehand. 100 percent recommend. It’s a great value and great tool. Cannot live without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product. It is sturdily built and worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It is sturdily built and worth the extra money. I didn't give it 5 stars because it is a little difficult to clean at times. Also, because it was billed as industrial grade, I expected to be able to crush more garlic at one time. That is not the case. It is about the same size basket as a standard garlic crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Just get the peeler, don't waste money on this press
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy with this garlic press. I don't normally write reviews but had to write for this one. I bought this garlic press because we use a lot of garlic in our food and its pain to chop if I can just use the press and do it in a few seconds. The garlic gets stuck so much on the sides, it doesn't press all the way through and gets difficult to clean every bit of it if you like to thoroughly clean it like I do. It takes longer to press, and clean vs CHOP it up. It's such a disgrace. The peeler works just fine and wish the press did a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Altruist

customer_reviews.title: BEST garlic press I've ever had--I'm thrilled with how well designed it is!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the BEST garlic press I have used in 30 years. I feel that way because most of the garlic actually comes out to be edible and used. All other garlic presses I have used seem to dispose of half the garlic on the refuse side of the press. (No one is paying me to express this enthusiasm. I am a housewife in Tennessee.) Finally a well designed top of the line garlic press!! Grateful to company that makes it!
customer_reviews.author: Readaholic

customer_reviews.title: The Best Garlic Press Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many garlic presses over the years. This is the best, most well made press I have ever bought. I LOVE it. The black sleeves is great to get the 'paper' off even the smallest little cloves. I put them all in the press and have great crushed garlic to use in my cooking. Many times I just use the black sleeve and put whole cloves. I use lots of garlic. Have the press or mincer as I call it makes my cooking so easy and I don't end up throwing away the little cloves! Well, just shows that in the long run I am saving money also!
customer_reviews.author: Pam DA

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works awesome! I’m a very cheap kind of person so we got a cheap garlic mincer from Walmart which didn’t work very well. So I decided to try this one. It is just great! The garlic doesn’t really get stuck(unless you let it sit for a while obviously) after you mince,it leaves a layer from the garlic in the mincer,so it just peels out. You may have 1 or 2 small pieces left in it but it comes with a brush for that!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Metz

customer_reviews.title: Bad seller, OK product
customer_reviews.text: The garlic press is OK. I prefer my OXO garlic press. It is absolutely absurd that is is originally "listed" at $45. I think that is just a gimmick to make you think you are getting a good deal. If you buy this garlic press just know you will get multiple emails from the seller asking you to rate it, etc. If I knew this before hand I would not have purchased this. Try the oxo garlic press.  It is more comfortable, and they don't harass you with emails.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Not my first garlic mincer, but hopefully my last. I have had some that were a pain to clean, some that did not work well (I do not want garlic 'mush') and two that I actually destroyed because they were so poorly made. I ordered this exact unit a while back and thought so much of it I ordered a second unit for our winter residence. Great little piece of equipment. I do have a garlic peeler that I like better than the one that ships with this, but it's okay...
customer_reviews.author: Steve McKenney

customer_reviews.title: Overly bulky, hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Although the material is of high quality, this utensil is overly bulky. It leaves a considerable amount of garlic left behind due to being stuck between the stamped seams. Cleaning out the residual skin is also a chore so forget about not having fragrant garlic fingers. Miss my simple, compact OXO! I do not recommend this product despite it's abundant positive reviews. It's peculiar there are so many for an item that will disappoint the average consumer.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: NOT SELF CLEANING!!! HARD TO CLEAN!!!
customer_reviews.text: CONS: Not self cleaning. Heavy. Hard to press. Seams that garlic gets stuck in and is hard to clean. PROS: None compared to other garlic presses.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kitchen Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: We had no idea what the soft tubular item that came with our garlic press until we looked at the picture. We've never heard of a garlic rocker before, but we love it. The product as a whole works wonders for us and keeps our hands off the garlic as much as possible. No more slicing and dicing to get our minced garlic; no more buying jars of minced garlic that may have sat in the store for months, and then even longer in our fridge. Now we can have fresh minced garlic in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quality press, ver satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I had an old pampered chef garlic press that was past it's prime and I decided to finally by a new garlic press. I use mine weekly and I am pretty picky about my kitchen gadgets, I cook a lot. I am very satisfied with the quality...it does the job and looks very sharp as well. It cleans up nice in the dishwasher. I would highly recommend this press.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: a very good value for the product
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very good value for the product! It presses garlic well, and I discovered that you don't even have to peel the garlic clove before pressing it (no garlic peel gets pressed through!). It does not press fresh ginger well, however. I've used my fair share of garlic presses, even the ~fancy~ ones from Williams Sanoma, and this is right on par with any garlic presses that are 2-3x more expensive. My one complaint is that the basin where the garlic sits is usually hard to clean out after pressing it, but that's typically par for the course with garlic presses. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes cooking way easier.
customer_reviews.text: My old garlic press was garbage and threw it away. After getting tired of having to manually chop garlic because it takes me forever I took time reading reviews and got this. I won't say it's totally NASA approved perfect but wow it works incredibly well. Makes doing the garlic way easier and cuts my cooking time down by like 10 minutes I'm serious.
customer_reviews.author: PonySlaystation

customer_reviews.title: Wife thinks it's AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: My wife says it is Awesome! Sturdy, easy to clean, makes using garlic a breeze! She likes the little brush that came with it, as it make cleaning easier. She didn't know what the roll did, until I told her it peals garlic...she likes her method best (cut of the pointed end, microwave for 10-20 seconds, and pinch...they will just slide right out)
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Not good.  Very hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a huge disappointment. The three piece mechanism is not very functional and very difficult to clean. I definitely returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Hard Pass on this Press
customer_reviews.text: I lost my pampered chef garlic press when we moved. I was hoping this could replace it but it's a piece of junk compared to pampered chef. It doesn't press all the garlic through with the skin on and even when you take it off, some is still stuck inside. It's a pain to clean too. It's easier and faster to just smash the garlic yourself and chop it with a good knife. I threw this away. Save your money and buy the one from pampered chef.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes galic easier
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews of different presses vs the "rocker" style and settled on this one. I had an ancient Oster press that was tiny and poorly designed. I am very pleased with this one! The skin remover sleeve is amazing. The press holds more than one clove and presses cleanly! It made my garlic work much easier for sure, and we love our garlic
customer_reviews.author: NissaMF

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy - Cannot be used more than once - hard to clean, use and maintain
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. The garlic presser simply does not work, the thing gets clogged with the garlic itself while trying to use it. It gets clogged and causes the garlic to slip thru the sides of the presser because the design does not allow. The end result is a mush of garlic and garlic juice all over the place except for the holes where the pressed garlic is supposed to flow through. This is more like a garlic juicer. If that is what you want, go for it. 0/5 for design and usability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a gift
customer_reviews.text: When I got this the box was crush. Was not happy about that due to it's a Christmas gift. Thank goodness my husband made another box for me to put it in. But can't say how good it is because it's not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read MANY reviews. Chose this. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: All garlic presses are hard to clean, that's what I learned from reading reviews. Its 100% worth the hassle of cleaning, though. I just make sure to get the skins out with a knife or sharp tip as soon as I've pressed the garlic, then cleaning from there is a cinch. I love both this garlic press and the roller that comes with it with all my heart
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Garlic Press
customer_reviews.text: Ends up that I do NOT use it much. Usually I chop 1-3 pieces of garlic at a time. It's as much work to clean the pressed garlic from the tiny holes as it is to chop the garlic myself. I'd be quite content with larger holes. I'm losing strength in my hands, I find it somewhat difficult to press the garlic, again, I think larger holes would make it easier to press the garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: I hate writing reviews when the seller bombards me with emails ...
customer_reviews.text: I hate writing reviews when the seller bombards me with emails requesting I do so. However--based on my limited testing (I crushed four cloves today) this press rocks! My old press was--old--maybe 25 years, and likely cheap. It barely pushed out the garlic, and was a bear to clean--and I had to peel the cloves, There is no comparison. Each unpeeled clove I plopped in and pressed resulted in beautiful crushed garlic--the clove was completely spent. Clean up was easy-peasy, the peeling came right out and I had no need to use the little cleaning brush that came with the press. No garlicky hands either.
customer_reviews.author: miesfan

customer_reviews.title: The press grate is not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for the first week or so and I really liked it. Unfortunately the back side of the press grate wall bent in while pressing and now I cant use it without bending it back. The metal in the grate that the garlic is pressed through is not strong enough to hold up to the amount of pressing force you can easily put without squeezing the handles that hard. Good design but clearly not much thought was put into how strong the grate needs to be to support the pressing force.
customer_reviews.author: Layton

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I thought this sounded like the perfect garlic press. I was wrong! I tried an unpeeled clove and could not get to begin to crush it. Even after peeling it, I found it difficult to apply enough to pressure. Once I got it to work it did a great job. I already threw my old garlic press away or I’d donate this one!
customer_reviews.author: A book lover

customer_reviews.title: The best garlic press I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different garlic press. I have one that is very similar except that the part that holds the garlic comes completely out once you use it. You have to put it back together before you can use it again. This one didn't come apart and that is why I really like it. It presses the garlic really fine. The cleaning isn't bad, but it does take some time since the garlic gets stuck to the little blades. I would recommend this item and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Better Out There
customer_reviews.text: Most of the high rating is for the garlic peeler roller. Very impressive. The device itself is pretty sturdy but is tedious to clean because the two sides of the moveable grated part are all connected. Usually the sides are open for easy cleaning but for this you'd have to dig to get all the garlic out. I also agree the handle seems hollow and I'm sure would collect water. There are definitely better out there.
customer_reviews.author: Zandrew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these because I'm the garlic addict. Unfortunately these do not meet my expectation. Most of the garlic seems to stay inside the tool and not extrude out the bottom. I find myself having to scrape out smash garlic that didn't extrude out the holes properly. About the only good thing I got from this was the garlic peeler that works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike37130

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart , but Orblue honored the warranty
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 month of casual use (about twice a week for homemade meals), the rivet broke off, rendering the tool unusable. If you read other 1 star reviews, you'll find similar reports of this issue. I've tried to contact Orblue through the Amazon messaging system. Orblue has not responded. They supposedly have lifetime warranty on the garlic press. I'm not sure if they will honor it. Probably not. [Update on 2019-03-11] - I got a replacement from Orblue. We'll see how the new one goes.
customer_reviews.author: shangjian

customer_reviews.title: Well made, comfortable and efficient garlic press.
customer_reviews.text: I’m no expert, but after using a garlic press with a plastic press part, this was wonderful to use. I like the heftiness of the well made tool. I get tendonitis in my wrist and I found this press very efficient and easy on my hands and wrist. It took some getting used to to clean the flopping part: I soak the press a little, grab the floppy part and the cleaning was effortless rinse.
customer_reviews.author: SueBee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set / Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this set for almost a two months now and have zero complaints. I use the crusher almost daily (most used tool in my kitchen next to the knives) and it's still sturdy and witness no rusting of any kind. Love that it came with a mini brush for cleaning - that's key when washing. The rubber is also easy to use, but I usually just peel the garlic manually. Really pleased with the set, especially for the price. Hope it holds up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rza1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot for me to write a product review. This garlic press was ~thirteen dollars and feels incredibly cheap in the hands. The one I received was clearly an open box return and there wasn't much effort put in before shipping it back out. If this were ~six or seven dollars, it would be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to clean it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product but make sure to clean it. Easy to clean but don't forget and let days go by other wise you have to leave it water for a day. This is perfect for crushing garlic. The trick is to put the crushed garlic in water for 10 minutes and then real man it down. Thanks again and your company is awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very high quality garlic press
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made kitchen tool. I had struggled with a plastic garlic press and gave up and have been using jarred garlic for years. I decided to try this garlic press and get some real garlic. Wow, as with anything, you need the right tools and this is it for garlic. So well made, easy to use, I would recommend to anyone. There is no substitute for fresh garlic and this is so easy and easy to clean. Very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: This garlic press is fine. It's functional. But I do have a few key complaints: 1) The rocker/peeler does NOTHING. Be prepared to peel the cloves yourself. 2) It is a pain to clean. The "pocket" where you put the garlic isn't soldered so bits of skin and garlic get stuck in the crack and it is very difficult to get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for myself and have really liked it. The best part for me is the silicone sleeve that is used to help remove the garlic skin. Liked it so much I bought another one for my daughter-in-law. She had been using a knife to chop up garlic and was super happy to get this needed kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bexter

customer_reviews.title: The garlic press feels good in the hand
customer_reviews.text: The garlic press feels good in the hand, it's got some weight to it. It looks and feels well made.... heavier construction so I think it will last a long time. Cutting up garlic with a knife isn't as effective; you need to press or smash garlic to get the juices flowing. You're going to get so much more flavor in the pan using the press. Anyone that truly likes cooking, needs to have a quality garlic press, and this press, is that!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Manning

customer_reviews.title: Good for Pressing a Small Amount of Garlic
customer_reviews.text: The press is well designed and good looking. However, if you only need to press one or two piece of garlic, this works fine. The problem is that the ski of the garlic stays in the tray, which means you will have dig it out after every press before putting another piece of garlic in the tray. If you need to chop more than one or two piece of garlic, it would be much easier to either chop it with a knife or in a small food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Mires

customer_reviews.title: Changed my Cooking Life
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a grater for my garlic. We startting putting an emphasis on eating healthy about 5 months ago and eating healthy calls for lots of garlic in recipes. So using the grater was fine, but I found my hands smelled like garlic even after washing them. And my grater smelled like garlic even after going through the dishwasher!! Your garlic press changed my life!! I’ve used it every day since i received it!! It’s made excellent! Washes easily! Thank you for making a great product! I will be purchasing another one for my son for Christmas!!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Bark

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now, you won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with this product! I hated chopping and mincing garlic myself and it left my fingers smelling. I didn’t even anticipate how easy the rubber piece makes peeling the garlic! My sister came over for thanksgiving and loved it so much, I bought her one! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SarahJ

customer_reviews.title: The real deal garlic press!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY, a garlic press that actually works! After purchasing my fair-share of garlic press duds, I’ve finally found one that does its job. I love the sturdiness of the press and easily it pushes the garlic out. I am so happy that I came across this specific press and went for it. So happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Melichar

customer_reviews.title: I use garlic all of the time
customer_reviews.text: I believe you can never have too much garlic so I use this almost everyday and it’s very easy to use and clean, I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a regular garlic press but works much better
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 5 garlic presses and none of them worked well. I would get almost nothing from pressing the garlic. This one looks very similar to the other garlic presses I have used, but I get much more garlic pressed out of it. I have all but given up on garlic presses, but decided to give this one a try and I use it a few times a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this garlic press
customer_reviews.text: I really like this garlic press. I have used others that don't do nearly as good a job at mincing the garlic and are difficult to clean the rest of the clove out of the chamber. I recommend this press to anyone who uses garlic in their cooking or in any other way where it is needed minced. The chamber separates from the base to make clean up easier. They give you a clove peeler with the press and I found that the peeled cloves mince up really well in this press.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brow

customer_reviews.title: wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses lots of garlic in her recipes, and she loves this thing. So far it's holding up to near constant use.
customer_reviews.author: a.r.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well at crushing garlic. I found it easy to clean with a rinse under the sink and some 'finger scrubbing' the insides. I've also put them in the dishwasher with no negative effects - these stood up to my dishwasher. I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunagain

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement but harder to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old garlic press with this one. I really like the look, design and ease of use. However, my other garlic press had an attachment that would push out all the garlic stuck in the pores. This one you have to individually stick through the holes. Just kind of tedious, but not a deal breaker
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: I started getting dinnerly meal kits at home. It seemed like every recipe I cooked needed fresh garlic. I ordered this, and it works great! It takes literally 30 seconds to mince a clove of garlic, and it way easier than me trying to do it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Zuspan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: This garlic press is much better than the press I had years ago (not sure what ever happened to it). Anyway, easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done quickly
customer_reviews.text: This press is replacing one that I had for years. I like the fact that it's stainless steel. Hopefully it will stay rust free for years to come. It does indeed crush even unpeeled garlic. Sometimes, though, some of the garlic gets stuck in the seams of the unit at the corners. I'm thankful for the little brush that came in the kit, which makes cleaning easier. The silicon sleeve makes peeling the garlic really easy, though I do first remove the root end of the cloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best garlic press I have used
customer_reviews.text: Just works as you would expect. Throw it in the dishwasher and it comes out clean. Previous garlic press was some kind of pot metal that oxidized when it came out of the dish washer. The stainless isn't harmed at all when run through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Frogday

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: This is clearly Stainless steel, I've had no issues with corrosion. And it can absolutely squeeze out Garlic without peeling the skin. This handy tool is making me inject too much garlic into my cooking :) Yum Yum. It is so easy! Glad to be a bachelor :)!
customer_reviews.author: Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Fresh-pressed Garlic ROCKS- This Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this garlic press! It's stainless steel, which is super cool. I had one for a long time that was aluminum. It would get pretty gnarly looking- reacting to dish soap (or garlic?). Oh, and a piece broke off of it, but I still used it. I finally splurged on this one, which is easier to clean, too. And presses beautifully. There's nothing quite like fresh-pressed garlic! At The New Deli, we process mounds of fresh garlic in our food processor, then freeze it in layers, in plastic bags. Works nice when you're making gallons of Italian dressing weekly, but when I want some "special" garlic, like to marinate fresh mozzarella in, fresh-pressed wins out big time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cote

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works much better than my old one which, admittedly, had finally come apart after decades of service. This seemed like a good replacement. So far so good, but maybe ask me again in a few years and we'll see if it holds up as well as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz

customer_reviews.title: Great Garlic Masher
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a pestle and mortor for mincing or mashing garlic. This is a nice alternative much easier on the hands and quicker with an easy cleanup. Great for people who eat the daily clove of garlic or mincing a large amount of garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty garlic press
customer_reviews.text: My garlic press of many years started turning my garlic gray so I had to replace it. I'm not sure what the advantages of this having 3 separate moving parts but it works really well and it's very heavy duty and you feel like you can really go to town on the garlic and it's not going to bend or break in any way.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Garlic Press
customer_reviews.text: I am not convinced it will last forever, because even the longer handle that I purchased could be longer. I think a sturdier and longer handle would be ideal. That said, this is working great and I don't understand some of the complaints I read. You will like this press and the rubber garlic roller that came with it is very, very cool!
customer_reviews.author: RealtimeDuck

customer_reviews.title: Absolute pathetic piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Just about all of the garlic gets stuck to the sides and very little garlic gets pressed through no matter how hard I press. This press is without question the worst I’ve ever used, you’re better off just mincing with a knife than using this pathetic excuse of a press. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If mincing garlic is the bane of your time in the kitchen, this is the tool for you!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product has made my life so much easier in the kitchen! My family loves garlic in and on nearly every dish, and this tool has taken ALL the work out of mincing garlic. The brush is perfect for cleaning the tool when I am done. I use a butter knife to remove the skins in between mincing cloves, and to scrape the garlic off the outside surface once it has been minced. It even works on ginger root! ( After it has been peeled, of course).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My old one was aluminum and should never have been put in the dishwasher. But it was. This one is stainless steel and can be put in the dishwasher. BTW it comes with a cleaning brush and a garlic roller that removes the peel. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: beats all other garlic presses
customer_reviews.text: this garlic press is built to last, it well made of good material. When you press the garlic, it press almost all the garlic, unlike cheaper presses. This press will last you a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Total crap! It took a solid 10 garlic cloves to get what maybe 2 hand cut would be.
customer_reviews.author: LeannJupina

customer_reviews.title: Good time saver, glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: So I was sick of spending all the time peeling and cutting the garlic. We use a lot in our house hold. Well this has definitely helped ALOT, but with that being said it’s not a miracle worked which is why I gave it 4 stars. It turns the garlic into almost a paste which isn’t a big deal, my problem is it doesn’t really come out and you more need to finger it out to get it nonetheless it is definitely a time saver and good product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex carfora

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Broke after probably 20 uses. I expected it to last much longer than the 10 months that I’ve had it.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK AT ALL!  DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I went to use this for the first time and peeled garlic will not press through, so what is the point of this? It is too late to get a refund, and I certainly don't want a replacement if it is the same brand! Very disappointed, especially since I am using lots of fresh garlic for my Thanksgiving dishes...
customer_reviews.author: Doug Golden

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a garlic press before and now wish I had purchased one years ago. This is a beautiful kitchen appliance, so easy to use, easy to clean. So much easier and quicker than using a knife to finely chop garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: So glad I upgraded - throw your crappy garlic press away!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this. As other reviewers said, it’s a garlic press, but a huge improvement from any other garlic press I’ve used. The silicone tube thingy is amazing at removing the peel easily, so no more stinky hands! And the press is easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Gisbert

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: It isn't the easiest garlic press to operate or clean. But it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: If you like garlic like I do you know that nothing short of fresh garlic will do and you must have a tool like this to make it easy to mince. They even give you the sleeve to remove the outer shell. Just a nice tool that is IMHO essential
customer_reviews.author: Car guy

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: Eh it’s okay. It crushes the garlic decently enough but it also gets pushed out the sides instead of completely going through the tiny holes. It’s okay for the price, but doesn’t work as well as I’d like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: This item is heavier than expected for my small hand. Seems that more garlic stays in the device than gets thru strainer. Just a tiny extra step to get the rest of the pulp compared to my last device. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: dc7447

customer_reviews.title: This garlic press is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been so excited about a garlic press! I have only used it a few times but so far so good. I love that it comes with a little brush to clean out the pieces of garlic that gets stuck in the sides and holes. I also love the tube you place the garlic in to roll out the garlic skin. This makes cooking so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Love this garlic press!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty garlic press. Comes with the little rubber roll where you place an unpeeled clove of garlic inside, roll it and voila! The outer peel is off! There’s also the little brush for cleaning the press.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Propresser is Properfect.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as you take take the Propresser out of its shipping box you are immediately impressed by the quality of its construction. All stainless steel plus robust construction lend to its highend feel. All of the above would be irrelevant if it did not excel at its primary function,crushing garlick. Before this purchase i cut garlick with a sharp knife and did a pretty good job,i thought. The Propresser makes a tedious and smelly job EZ. The end result is that youre favorite foods have a stronger Garlic taste, due to the uniformity of how the cloves have been crushed. In closing, a great product that would make the "Chef of the future" proud
customer_reviews.author: BOBTEK

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: It works really well at first, the after 4 or 5 uses it broke from the handle. If it was better made it would be good, unless I just happened to get a defective one, but this one is in the trash and it wasnt even a month old.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: It is great quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We just got this garlic press a week ago, and have used it a few times now. It is great quality, easy to use, and does the job with ease. I used it with some huge garlic cloves, and I like it much better than my more expensive Pampered Chef one. It seems to take a little less pressure to squeeze out the garlic, and you do not even have to peel it first, although it is easier to squish if it's peeled. Easy cleanup and believe it will last for years! Thanks for a great product at a good price:)
customer_reviews.author: Mak

customer_reviews.title: New to garlic tools but love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to get better at chopping garlic but it takes too long and I can't ever get the chops to be even. I decided to use this tool to mince garlic instead and WOW. I've never chopped garlic afterwards! The garlic becomes more flavorful and the natural juices make my meals more tastier than ever! I really like the garlic peeler tool! I never heard of something like this and now I get excited to add garlic to my recipes because of the fun new toys I can use! Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Dolores G.

customer_reviews.title: Inefficient design
customer_reviews.text: I hate this press...the hopper is in 2 pieces The press is difficult to clean after use. Overall I would is not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Oceanus

product_meta.title: Orblue Garlic Press [Premium], Stainless Steel Mincer, Crusher & Peeler Set-Professional Grade, Easy Clean, Dishwasher Safe & Rust-proof, 7.5"", Metal, Black
feature_bullets: PROFESSIONAL GRADE GARLIC PRESS: Stainless steel, rust proof garlic press can mince, chop, and crush food with restaurant quality and ease. This will be the best tool in your kitchen.

HEAVY DUTY CONSTRUCTION: The heavy duty construction and ergonomic design, ensure you can easily mince unpeeled garlic cloves or peeled ginger root quickly and with minimal effort. Simply press the handles and delicious paste will ooze out, leaving the peel inside. It's like magic!
EASY TO CLEAN: The garlic press with roller is a breeze to clean. Just place in the dishwasher machine or run through water. Clean up could not be any easier.

VARIETY OF USES: No more manually hand chopping your garlic! This garlic press perfectly minces, chops, slices, and grinds garlic so your veggie, meat, sauce, or salad dressing will be so delicious your guests will think you had a professional chef!
LIFETIME GUARANTEE: Count on the Orblue Stainless Steel Garlic Press or your money back! Click 'Add to Cart' now and enjoy our no-questions-asked, 100% satisfaction guarantee!
